issue.title: Feature bet sizing from probability

repository.name: mlfinlab
repository.description: MlFinLab helps portfolio managers and traders who want to leverage the power of machine learning by providing reproducible, interpretable, and easy to use tools.

issue.body:
# Description

Added `bet_size_probability()` function, plus supporting functions (chapter 10 snippets). Unit tests have been built to test `ch10_snippets.py` (the units that make up the user-level functions). The file `bet_sizing.py` also has the skeletons of the 2 other functions that must be added. A notebook for testing the `bet_size_probability()` function is included, but is not of tutorial quality. This will have to be polished in a future update with the other 2 functions.

Contributes to fixing issues #76 and #77

## Type of change

Please delete options that are not relevant.
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

# How Has This Been Tested?

The unit test is included in the `bet_sizing` folder, but must be moved to the `test` folder when finished. The unit test file `test_ch10_snippets.py` contains all relevant test cases.

- [x] test_get_signal
- [x] test_avg_active_signals
- [x] test_discrete_signal

**Test Configuration**:
* Windows 10
* VS Code
* pytest


# Checklist:

- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published in downstream modules

issue.title: Bet sizing

repository.name: mlfinlab
repository.description: MlFinLab helps portfolio managers and traders who want to leverage the power of machine learning by providing reproducible, interpretable, and easy to use tools.

issue.body:
# Description

This PR contains the complete submodule on Bet Sizing from Chapter 10, as well as an implementation of the EF3M algorithm.

This PR contributes to fixing issues #76 and #77.

## Type of change

Please delete options that are not relevant.

- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

# How Has This Been Tested?

Unit tests for each of the files in bet_sizing can be found in the tests folder.

**Local Test Configuration**:
* Windows 10
* VS Code
* pytest
